intro: Atelophragma guatemalense, commonly known as the Guatemalan spurge, is a flowering plant native to Central America. It belongs to the Euphorbiaceae family, which includes many species with milky sap. The plant typically grows as an herbaceous shrub, featuring simple, alternate leaves with a slightly hairy surface. Its small, clustered flowers are usually yellowish-green, and it produces capsule fruits that contain numerous seeds. It is often found in moist, shaded environments such as forests and along stream banks.
